content.prompt: Which of the following public policy problems is most likely to result from the situation shown in the chart?

choices.label: Government employees may become responsible for larger bodies of regulation than they can effectively monitor.
Regulations may apply to an increasingly small portion of industry as the economy grows.
Governmental hiring patterns may draw too many educated workers from the private sector.
The influence of special-interest groups may increase as the number of federal employees grows.
Increases in the number of federal employees may necessitate the construction of new and expensive federal facilities.

topic.text: 1.7: Relationship Between the States and National Government
